availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Eison and Martha Eison. Married to Virginia A. Williamson Eison in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on November 29, 1857. Father of Fannie Eison and J. J. Eison. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Household owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 285B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 61.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 221B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 478B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1778-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Montgomery County Marriages, p. 48.
"Michael Eison (1837-1918)," Memorial #131726409, Find A Grave, accessed May 10, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/131726409.
